column1: Oversampling for Imbalanced Data via Optimal Transport
Yuguang Yan@South China University of Technology

column1: The issue of data imbalance occurs in many real-world applications especially in medical diagnosis
column2: where normal cases are usually much more than the abnormal cases. To alleviate this issue
column3: one of the most important approaches is the oversampling method
column4: which seeks to synthesize minority class samples to balance the numbers of different classes. However
column5: existing methods barely consider global geometric information involved in the distribution of minority class samples
column6: and thus may incur distribution mismatching between real and synthetic samples. In this paper
column8: we propose an oversampling method by exploiting global geometric information of data to make synthetic samples follow a similar distribution to that of minority class samples. Moreover
column9: we introduce a novel regularization based on synthetic samples and shift the distribution of minority class samples according to loss information. Experiments on toy and real-world data sets demonstrate the efficacy of our proposed method in terms of multiple metrics.
